ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Speak Spanish better with a wider variety of tenses.I think I'm more comfortable with the language.
an acute understanding of spanish this class definitely improved my speaking skills, everyday nearly every person in class was called on to participate in some way
I learned how to speak spanish better than I previously could.
Learned to appreciate Spanish for more than just its credits
Spanish 120 did a very solid job of covering more challenging grammatical concepts, improving my vocal and overall helping me to become a better Spanish speaker/writer.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: My favorite thing was skits we did in class; I feel like they were always fun and promoted a lot of practice.
A strength is that there is a lot of discussion, and a weakness is that the material and testing should be more cumulative.
I would like to have more conversations in class in Spanish but I understand that it is difficult to fit that in along with the material. Sooo.. idk how to improve it really.
Overall this course was quite strong. There were no major weaknesses. The "special" days like the trial of the mayor and oral presentations are fun and engaging.
This class covered several aspects of grammar and culture. It moves quickly but not at a too-fast to handle pace.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I think it really helped.
It's a great course, it wont be very hard if you do the daily/weekly work. If you get behind though it will be difficult
Spanish 120 is a great class for someone who has a basic understanding of Spanish (L1 or high school). I feel prepared for the l3 level.

Yes. Spanish 120 is interesting but not overwhelming. It offered many different types of assessments from written quizzes, tests and essays to listening exams and oral exams and overall improved my language skills.
